title: Run TypeScript check — zero errors
description:
Run `npx tsc --noEmit` from project root.
Fix ALL TypeScript errors. Do not use @ts-ignore or @ts-nocheck.
If there are type mismatches in Supabase auto-generated types, 
cast carefully with `as` only when truly needed.
Log the count of errors before and after.

title: Run Vite build — zero errors
description:
Run `npx vite build`. Fix any build errors.
Common issues: missing imports, circular dependencies, 
unresolved aliases. Fix them all.
The build must complete with zero errors.

title: Audit console for runtime errors on admin dashboard
description:
Start dev server. Navigate to /:tenantSlug/admin/dashboard.
Open browser console. Report and fix any:
- Red errors (not warnings)
- Failed network requests
- React key warnings
- Unhandled promise rejections
Fix each one at the source.

title: Audit console for runtime errors on storefront builder
description:
Navigate to /:tenantSlug/admin/storefront.
Check console for errors. Fix all red errors.
Ensure the builder page loads without crashing.
If it shows a blank page or error boundary, trace and fix.

title: Audit console for runtime errors on storefront settings
description:
Navigate to /:tenantSlug/admin/storefront/settings.
Fix all console errors. Ensure all tabs render.

title: Audit console for runtime errors on live orders
description:
Navigate to /:tenantSlug/admin/storefront/orders.
Fix console errors. Ensure realtime subscription connects.

title: Audit console for runtime errors on analytics
description:
Navigate to /:tenantSlug/admin/storefront/analytics.
Fix console errors. Ensure charts render (even with no data).

title: Audit console on public storefront homepage
description:
Navigate to /shop/:storeSlug (use any existing store slug).
If no store exists, create one first via admin.
Fix all console errors on the public storefront.

title: Audit console on product catalog page
description:
Navigate to /shop/:storeSlug/products.
Fix all errors. Ensure products load or empty state shows.

title: Audit console on product detail page
description:
Navigate to /shop/:storeSlug/products/:productId.
Fix errors. If no products exist, create test data first.

title: Audit console on cart page
description:
Navigate to /shop/:storeSlug/cart.
Fix errors. Ensure empty cart state renders cleanly.

title: Audit console on checkout page
description:
Navigate to /shop/:storeSlug/checkout.
Fix errors. If cart is empty, it should redirect to cart or show message.

title: Remove all console.log statements
description:
Search entire src/ for console.log, console.warn, console.error.
Replace with logger.debug, logger.warn, logger.error from @/lib/logger.
Exception: keep console.error in error boundaries only.
Run: grep -rn "console\." src/ --include="*.ts" --include="*.tsx" | grep -v node_modules

title: Remove all @ts-ignore and @ts-nocheck
description:
Search for @ts-ignore, @ts-nocheck, @ts-expect-error.
Fix the underlying type issue instead.
Run: grep -rn "@ts-" src/ --include="*.ts" --include="*.tsx"

title: Remove all 'any' types
description:
Search for ": any" and "as any" in all .ts/.tsx files.
Replace with proper types or 'unknown' with type guards.
Run: grep -rn ": any\b" src/ --include="*.ts" --include="*.tsx"

title: Verify all storefront routes exist in App.tsx
description:
Open src/App.tsx and verify these routes exist:
ADMIN (protected):
- /:tenantSlug/admin/storefront → StorefrontBuilder
- /:tenantSlug/admin/storefront/settings → StorefrontSettings
- /:tenantSlug/admin/storefront/orders → StorefrontLiveOrders
- /:tenantSlug/admin/storefront/analytics → StorefrontAnalytics
PUBLIC (no auth):
- /shop/:storeSlug → StorefrontPage (nested layout)
- /shop/:storeSlug/products → ProductCatalogPage
- /shop/:storeSlug/products/:productId → ProductDetailPage
- /shop/:storeSlug/cart → CartPage
- /shop/:storeSlug/checkout → CheckoutPage
- /shop/:storeSlug/order/:orderId → OrderConfirmationPage
Add any missing routes. Ensure public routes do NOT have auth guards.

title: Verify storefront nav items in admin sidebar
description:
Check src/lib/constants/navigation.ts (or wherever sidebar nav is defined).
Ensure "Storefront" group exists with sub-items:
- Builder (links to /:tenantSlug/admin/storefront)
- Settings (links to /:tenantSlug/admin/storefront/settings)
- Live Orders (links to /:tenantSlug/admin/storefront/orders)
- Analytics (links to /:tenantSlug/admin/storefront/analytics)
Use appropriate Lucide icons (Store, Settings, ShoppingBag, BarChart3).
Wrap in FeatureGate if feature flag system exists.

title: Verify Supabase connection works
description:
Test that Supabase client connects successfully.
Run a simple query: supabase.from('marketplace_stores').select('count').
If connection fails, check .env has VITE_SUPABASE_URL and VITE_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY.
Do NOT edit .env — just verify it exists and is loaded.

title: Verify marketplace_stores table schema
description:
Query the marketplace_stores table structure.
Ensure these columns exist:
id, tenant_id, name, slug, description, logo_url, theme, theme_config,
layout_config (JSONB), status (draft/published), published_at,
delivery_enabled, pickup_enabled, tax_rate, delivery_zones (JSONB),
seo_title, seo_description, custom_domain, created_at, updated_at.
If any critical columns are missing, create a migration to add them.
Ensure RLS is enabled with tenant_id policy.

title: Verify orders + order_items table schema
description:
Verify orders table has:
id, tenant_id, store_id, order_number, customer_name, customer_email,
customer_phone, delivery_address (JSONB), fulfillment_method,
status, subtotal, tax_amount, delivery_fee, total, notes,
payment_method, source (storefront/pos/wholesale), customer_id (FK nullable),
created_at, updated_at.
Verify order_items has:
id, order_id (FK), product_id (FK), product_name, variant, quantity,
unit_price, line_total.
Add missing columns via migration. Ensure RLS on both tables.

title: Store creation — no-store empty state
description:
When tenant has no store in marketplace_stores, the builder page should show 
a "Create Your Store" card — NOT a blank page or error.
Check StorefrontBuilder.tsx for the empty state.
If missing, add: centered card with store name input, slug input, 
theme selector thumbnails, and "Create Store" button.
Query: marketplace_stores where tenant_id = current tenant, if 0 rows → show create card.

title: Store creation — slug auto-generation
description:
When user types store name, auto-generate slug (lowercase, hyphens, no special chars).
Example: "Snak Station LES" → "snak-station-les"
Slug field should be editable after auto-generation.
Show live preview: "Your store URL: /shop/snak-station-les"

title: Store creation — slug uniqueness validation
description:
Before saving, check if slug already exists in marketplace_stores.
If duplicate, show inline error: "This URL is already taken. Try another."
Debounce the check (300ms) as user types in the slug field.

title: Store creation — credit gating
description:
Store creation should cost 500 credits (if credits system is active).
Use useCreditGatedAction hook. If insufficient credits, show 
OutOfCreditsModal. If credits system is not active or not found,
allow store creation without credits (don't crash).
Wrap in try-catch. Graceful fallback if credits tables don't exist.

title: Store creation — successful insert
description:
On "Create Store" click:
1. Validate name (required, min 2 chars)
2. Validate slug (required, unique, URL-safe)
3. Insert into marketplace_stores with tenant_id, name, slug, 
   theme (selected or default 'minimalist'), status 'draft',
   layout_config [] (empty array)
4. On success: toast "Store created!" and transition to the editor view
5. On error: toast with error message, don't navigate away
6. Invalidate TanStack query for marketplace_stores

title: Store creation — theme selection during creation
description:
Show 4 theme preview thumbnail cards on the create store card.
Each shows a small visual preview + theme name.
Default to 'minimalist'. User clicks to select. Selected gets a 
checkmark/ring highlight. Pass selected theme to the insert.

title: Add Section dropdown — all 8 types
description:
The "Add Section" button/dropdown must list all section types:
1. Hero Banner
2. Product Grid
3. Features
4. Testimonials
5. Newsletter Signup
6. Image Gallery
7. FAQ
8. Custom HTML
Each option should have an icon and label.
On click: adds a new section object to the sections array with 
default config for that type. Section appears in the left panel list.

title: Hero section edit dialog
description:
Hero section edit dialog fields:
- Headline (text input, default "Welcome to Our Store")
- Subheadline (text input)
- CTA button text (text input, default "Shop Now")
- CTA button link (text input, default "/shop/:slug/products")
- Background image (file upload to Supabase Storage bucket storefront-assets)
- Overlay opacity (slider 0-100%, default 40%)
- Text alignment (left/center/right radio buttons)
- Text color (white/dark toggle)
Save button saves to the section's config in layout_config.
Cancel button discards changes.

title: Product Grid section edit dialog
description:
Product Grid section edit dialog fields:
- Section title (text, default "Our Products")
- Number of columns (select: 2/3/4, default 3)
- Max products to display (number input, default 12)
- Filter by category (dropdown populated from product_categories for this tenant)
- Sort order (select: newest/price-low/price-high/name/thc-high)
- Show "View All" link (toggle, links to catalog page)
Save persists to section config.

title: Features section edit dialog
description:
Features section edit dialog:
- Section title (text)
- Array of feature items (min 1, max 6):
  Each item: icon picker (Lucide icons), title (text), description (textarea)
- Add Feature button / Remove button per item
Default: 3 empty feature items.

title: Testimonials section edit dialog
description:
Testimonials edit dialog:
- Section title (text)
- Array of testimonials:
  Each: quote text (textarea), customer name (text), rating (1-5 stars)
- Add/Remove testimonial buttons
Default: 2 empty testimonial items.

title: Newsletter section edit dialog
description:
Newsletter edit dialog:
- Section title (text, default "Stay Updated")
- Description text (textarea)
- Button text (text, default "Subscribe")
- Placeholder text (text, default "Enter your email")
Note: actual email collection saves to a newsletter_subscribers table 
or just stores in tenant's customer list.

title: Gallery section edit dialog
description:
Gallery edit dialog:
- Section title (text)
- Image uploads (multi-file upload to Supabase Storage)
- Layout style (select: grid/masonry/carousel)
- Max images to display (number)
Images stored as array of URLs in section config.

title: FAQ section edit dialog
description:
FAQ edit dialog:
- Section title (text, default "Frequently Asked Questions")
- Array of Q&A pairs:
  Each: question (text input), answer (textarea)
- Add/Remove buttons
Default: 3 empty Q&A items.
Renders as shadcn Accordion on the storefront.

title: Custom HTML section edit dialog
description:
Custom HTML edit dialog:
- Code editor textarea (monospace font, dark background)
- Optional CSS textarea
- Preview toggle to see rendered result
Content sanitized with DOMPurify before rendering on storefront.
If DOMPurify not installed: npm install dompurify @types/dompurify

title: Section edit dialogs — save functionality
description:
ALL section edit dialogs must:
1. Open pre-filled with current section config
2. Have Save and Cancel buttons
3. Save updates the section in the local sections array state
4. Mark the builder as having unsaved changes
5. NOT auto-save to database (user must click Save Draft or Publish)
6. Close the dialog on save
Verify every section type's dialog actually saves properly.

title: Section delete with confirmation
description:
Each section card has a delete button (trash icon).
On click: show confirmation dialog "Delete this section? This cannot be undone."
Confirm: removes section from array, marks unsaved changes.
Cancel: closes dialog, no change.

title: Section collapse/expand
description:
Each section card in the left panel should be collapsible.
Collapsed: shows only section type icon + title + drag handle.
Expanded: shows full config summary + edit/delete buttons.
Toggle via chevron icon.

title: Drag and drop — sections reorder correctly
description:
Verify @dnd-kit is properly configured in the builder:
- DndContext with closestCenter strategy
- SortableContext with verticalListSortingStrategy
- Each section wrapped in useSortable
- Drag handle (GripVertical icon) on left edge of each card
- On dragEnd: arrayMove to reorder sections array
- Visual feedback during drag (opacity change, placeholder)
Test: drag section 3 above section 1 → verify order changes.

title: Drag and drop — order persists to layout_config
description:
After drag reorder, the new section order must be saved when user 
clicks Save Draft or Publish. The layout_config JSONB column stores 
the ordered array of sections.
Verify: reorder → save → refresh page → sections still in new order.

title: Drag and drop — no crash with single section
description:
Edge case: if only 1 section exists, drag should not crash.
If 0 sections exist, drag context should still be stable (no errors).

title: Theme selector — 4 themes with previews
description:
Verify storefrontThemes.ts exports 4 themes:
1. Dark Mode (#0a0a0a bg, #22c55e primary, neon green)
2. Minimalist (#ffffff bg, #0f172a primary, clean slate)
3. Strain Focused (#fefce8 bg, #65a30d primary, earthy warm)
4. Luxury (#1a1a2e bg, #d4af37 primary, gold/champagne)
Each theme defines: colors (bg, primary, secondary, accent, muted, text),
fonts, border radius, and CSS variables.
Theme selector shows preview cards. Selected theme gets checkmark.

title: Theme — CSS variables apply to preview
description:
When theme is selected in the builder, CSS variables should update 
on the preview panel immediately (no save needed).
Variables set on wrapper div via inline style or CSS custom properties.
Verify: select Luxury theme → preview panel shows dark bg with gold accents.

title: Theme — persists to database
description:
Selected theme saves to marketplace_stores.theme (string: 'dark'/'minimalist'/
'strain_focused'/'luxury') and optionally theme_config (JSONB for overrides).
Verify: save → refresh → correct theme still selected.

title: Theme — applies on public storefront
description:
When customer visits /shop/:storeSlug, the store's theme CSS variables 
must be applied to the ShopLayout wrapper.
Fetch theme from marketplace_stores, apply CSS vars to root div.
Verify: store set to Dark theme → customer sees dark background, green accents.

title: Preview panel — renders sections live
description:
Right side of builder shows a scaled preview of the storefront.
As sections are added/edited, preview updates in real-time.
Each section type has a preview renderer.
If preview is blank or shows errors, trace and fix.

title: Preview panel — viewport toggle
description:
Preview toolbar has Desktop/Tablet/Mobile toggle buttons.
Desktop: preview at 1280px width.
Tablet: preview at 768px width.
Mobile: preview at 375px width.
Container resizes smoothly with transition.

title: Preview panel — scroll sync
description:
Clicking a section in the left panel scrolls the preview to that section.
Each section in preview has an id attribute matching the section id.
Use scrollIntoView with smooth behavior.

title: Full-screen editor — entry card
description:
When user first lands on the builder, show EditorEntryCard:
"Open Storefront Studio in full screen for the best editing experience"
with a "Launch Studio" button.
Also show a "Continue in compact mode" text link below.
If store doesn't exist yet, show Create Store card instead.

title: Full-screen editor — portal opens
description:
Clicking "Launch Studio" opens the builder in a full-screen portal.
Uses ReactDOM.createPortal to document.body.
Full-screen has: top toolbar (store name, viewport toggle, Save Draft, 
Publish, Close X), left panel (sections), right panel (preview).
ESC key closes full-screen. Close button closes full-screen.
All state preserved (no remount, no data loss).

title: Full-screen editor — exit preserves state
description:
Exiting full-screen returns to the compact builder view.
All section changes made in full-screen are preserved.
Unsaved changes flag still active if changes were made.

title: Save Draft — persists all data
description:
"Save Draft" button:
1. Serializes sections array to JSON → layout_config column
2. Saves theme selection → theme column
3. Status stays 'draft'
4. Toast: "Draft saved successfully"
5. Clears unsaved changes flag
6. Invalidates marketplace_stores query
Verify: add 3 sections, save draft, refresh → all 3 sections still there.

title: Publish — makes store live
description:
"Publish" button:
1. Same as Save Draft PLUS:
2. Sets status to 'published'
3. Sets published_at to now()
4. Toast: "Store published! Live at /shop/{slug}" with clickable link
5. Store is now accessible at /shop/:storeSlug
Verify: publish → visit /shop/:slug → store loads with sections.

title: Unpublish — takes store offline
description:
If store is published, show "Unpublish" option (in dropdown or as button).
On click: confirmation dialog → sets status to 'draft'.
Public storefront returns 404 or "Store not available" page.
Toast: "Store unpublished"

title: Unsaved changes — warn before leaving
description:
If user has unsaved changes and tries to navigate away:
Show UnsavedChangesDialog: "You have unsaved changes. Save before leaving?"
Options: Save & Leave, Leave Without Saving, Cancel.
Also hook into beforeunload browser event for tab close.

title: Easy Mode editor — simplified interface
description:
Verify EasyModeEditor.tsx works:
Simplified builder for non-technical tenants.
Shows: store name, logo upload, color picker, product toggle.
Auto-generates a layout with Hero + ProductGrid + FAQ.
Toggle between Easy Mode and Advanced Mode (full builder).

title: Mode toggle — state preserved between modes
description:
Switching from Easy to Advanced should preserve the sections 
created in Easy mode. Switching back should show the simplified view.
No data loss on toggle.

title: Settings — General tab works
description:
StorefrontSettings.tsx General tab:
- Store name (loads current, saves on change)
- Store slug (editable with uniqueness check)
- Store description (textarea)
- Logo upload (Supabase Storage, shows preview after upload)
- Favicon upload
Save button at bottom. All fields use React Hook Form + Zod.
Verify: change name → save → refresh → name persists.

title: Settings — SEO tab works
description:
SEO tab:
- Meta title (text input)
- Meta description (textarea, char count)
- OG image upload
- Keywords (tag input)
Values save to marketplace_stores seo columns.

title: Settings — Delivery & Fulfillment tab
description:
Delivery tab:
- Enable delivery toggle
- Enable pickup toggle
- Tax rate input (percentage)
- Delivery zones manager:
  List of zones, each with: zone name, zip codes (comma-separated),
  delivery fee ($), minimum order ($), estimated delivery time (minutes).
  Add Zone / Remove Zone buttons.
Values save to marketplace_stores delivery columns + delivery_zones JSONB.
This directly affects checkout pricing.

title: Settings — Payment Methods tab
description:
Add a Payment Methods tab to StorefrontSettings if it doesn't exist:
- Cash on Delivery toggle (default: on)
- Venmo toggle + Venmo handle input (e.g., @snak-station)
- Zelle toggle + Zelle email/phone input
- Stripe toggle + connection status (if Stripe keys configured)
Save to marketplace_stores or tenant_settings.
These options appear as payment choices during checkout.

title: Settings — Notification & Links tab
description:
Add a Notifications/Links tab:
- Telegram bot token input (for auto-forwarding orders)
- Telegram chat ID input (group/channel to forward to)
- "Test Telegram" button (sends a test message)
- Custom link label (e.g., "Message us on Telegram")
- Custom link URL (e.g., "https://t.me/snakstation")
- Show link on checkout confirmation toggle
- Enable email notifications for new orders toggle
- Notification email address
Save to tenant_settings or marketplace_stores.

title: Settings — Store Hours tab
description:
Store hours:
Day-by-day schedule (Mon-Sun), each with:
- Open toggle
- Open time (time input)
- Close time (time input)
Shows "Currently Open" or "Currently Closed" badge based on hours.
Optionally hide products or disable checkout outside hours.

title: Settings — all tabs save independently
description:
Each settings tab has its own Save button.
Saving one tab doesn't affect others.
Loading states on save buttons.
Error handling with toast messages.
Verify: change something in Delivery tab → save → go to General tab → 
General tab still shows original values (not affected by Delivery save).

title: Store preview button — opens in modal
description:
StorePreviewButton in the builder toolbar:
- "Preview" button with Eye icon
- Opens store in a modal/dialog at near-full-screen
- OR opens in new tab: window.open('/shop/' + storeSlug, '_blank')
- Viewport toggle in modal (desktop/tablet/mobile)

title: Store preview — works even when draft
description:
Preview should work even when store is in 'draft' status.
Option A: add ?preview=true query param that bypasses status check.
Option B: preview uses local sections state, not database.
The admin should always be able to preview their work.

title: Products sync to storefront
description:
Products from the admin's products table should appear on the storefront.
ProductGridSection fetches from products where tenant_id = store's tenant_id.
ProductCatalogPage does the same with filters.
If products have a 'published' or 'visible' flag, respect it.
If products have stock_quantity, show "Out of Stock" when 0.

title: Product visibility toggle for storefront
description:
In the admin products list, each product should have a toggle or checkbox:
"Show on Storefront" (visible_on_storefront boolean column).
Only products with this enabled appear on the public storefront.
Default: true for new products.
If column doesn't exist, add migration.

title: Product images on storefront
description:
Products must display their images on the storefront.
Check that products.image_url or products.images (JSONB array) 
is populated and renders correctly on:
- ProductCard component
- ProductGridSection
- ProductCatalogPage
- ProductDetailPage (gallery)
If no image: show a clean placeholder (not broken img icon).

title: Product categories for storefront filters
description:
ProductCatalogPage sidebar filter needs categories.
Query product_categories for this tenant_id.
If product_categories table is empty or doesn't exist, 
fall back to reading distinct category values from products table.
Categories should show as checkboxes in the filter sidebar.

title: ShopLayout — loads store data by slug
description:
ShopLayout.tsx wraps all /shop/:storeSlug/* routes.
On mount: fetch marketplace_stores where slug = :storeSlug AND status = 'published'.
Use get_marketplace_store_by_slug RPC if it exists, otherwise direct query.
If not found or not published: render a styled "Store Not Found" page.
If found: set theme CSS variables, render header + children + footer.

title: ShopLayout — sticky header
description:
Store header shows: logo (left), store name, nav links 
(Home, Products, Cart), cart icon with item count badge.
Header is sticky on scroll. Transparent on hero section, 
solid background when scrolled past hero.
Mobile: hamburger menu for nav, cart icon always visible.

title: ShopLayout — footer
description:
Store footer: store name, description, store hours (if configured),
contact info, custom links (from settings), 
"Powered by FloraIQ" text with link.

title: ShopLayout — age verification gate
description:
If tenant has age verification enabled (cannabis products):
First visit shows a full-page overlay: "Are you 21 or older?"
Yes → sets localStorage flag, shows store.
No → redirects to a "Sorry, you must be 21+" page.
Verification persists in localStorage per store slug.

title: ShopLayout — mobile bottom nav
description:
On mobile (< 768px), show a fixed bottom navigation bar:
Home, Products, Cart (with badge), Account/Menu.
This replaces the hamburger menu for better mobile UX.
Icons from Lucide. Active state highlighting.

title: ShopLayout — cart drawer
description:
Clicking the cart icon in the header opens a slide-over drawer (Sheet)
from the right showing cart items, quantities, subtotal, and 
"View Cart" + "Checkout" buttons.
Quick add/remove quantity controls in the drawer.

title: StorefrontPage — renders all sections from layout_config
description:
StorefrontPage.tsx reads layout_config from the store data.
For each section in the array, renders the corresponding component:
- type: 'hero' → HeroSection
- type: 'product_grid' → ProductGridSection
- type: 'features' → FeaturesSection
- type: 'testimonials' → TestimonialsSection
- type: 'newsletter' → NewsletterSection
- type: 'gallery' → GallerySection
- type: 'faq' → FAQSection
- type: 'custom_html' → CustomHTMLSection
Each section receives its config as props.
If layout_config is empty: show a "Coming Soon" page with store name.

title: HeroSection — renders correctly
description:
HeroSection renders:
- Full-width background image (from config)
- Gradient overlay (opacity from config)
- Headline text (large, themed)
- Subheadline text
- CTA button (links to products page or custom URL)
- Text alignment from config
If no background image: use a themed gradient as fallback.
Responsive: text scales down on mobile, CTA button full-width on mobile.

title: ProductGridSection — fetches and renders products
description:
ProductGridSection fetches products from the tenant's products table.
Respects section config: column count, max products, category filter, sort.
Renders ProductCard components in a responsive grid.
"View All Products" link at bottom if configured.
If no products: show "Products coming soon" message.
Loading state: show skeleton cards.

title: FeaturesSection — renders feature cards
description:
Renders a grid of feature cards from config.
Each card: Lucide icon (resolve by name string), title, description.
3 columns on desktop, 2 on tablet, 1 on mobile.
If features array is empty: don't render the section at all.

title: TestimonialsSection — renders testimonials
description:
Renders testimonial cards from config.
Each: quote text in quotes, customer name, star rating (filled/empty stars).
Display as: horizontal carousel (swipeable on mobile) or grid.
If no testimonials: don't render section.

title: NewsletterSection — email capture form
description:
Renders: title, description, email input, subscribe button.
On submit: save email to a newsletter_subscribers table or customers table 
with source='newsletter'. Toast: "Thanks for subscribing!"
If table doesn't exist, create it or just show the UI without backend save 
(log the email for now).

title: GallerySection — renders images
description:
Renders image grid from config.
Images loaded from URLs in config array.
Layout based on config: grid (CSS grid), masonry, or carousel.
Click image: open lightbox (full-screen with close button).
Lazy loading with loading="lazy" on images.

title: FAQSection — renders accordion
description:
Renders shadcn/ui Accordion with Q&A items from config.
Each item: question as trigger, answer as content.
Single or multiple items expandable.
Clean typography, good spacing.

title: CustomHTMLSection — renders sanitized HTML
description:
Renders HTML from config, sanitized with DOMPurify.
Install if needed: npm install dompurify @types/dompurify.
Use dangerouslySetInnerHTML with sanitized content.
Also apply optional CSS from config (scoped to section).

title: ProductCatalogPage — loads all products
description:
Fetches products from products table where tenant_id = store's tenant.
Uses get_marketplace_products RPC if available, or direct query.
Only show products where visible_on_storefront = true (or is_active = true).
Exclude products with stock_quantity = 0 or show them as "Out of Stock".
Loading: show skeleton cards grid.
Error: show error message with retry button.

title: Product catalog — category filter
description:
Sidebar (desktop) or filter drawer (mobile) has category checkboxes.
Populated from product_categories or distinct product.category values.
Checking a category filters the grid to only show matching products.
Multiple categories can be selected (OR logic).
"All" option clears category filter.

title: Product catalog — strain type filter
description:
Filter checkboxes for: Indica, Sativa, Hybrid, CBD.
Filters products by strain_type column.
If products don't have strain_type (non-cannabis store), 
hide this filter section entirely.

title: Product catalog — price range filter
description:
Dual-handle range slider for price.
Min/max auto-detected from product prices.
Also allow manual number inputs for min and max.
Filter products where price >= min AND price <= max.

title: Checkout handler — create order in database
description:
When "Place Order" is clicked:

1. Call storefront-checkout edge function (or client-side if edge function doesn't work):
   Payload: {
     storeSlug, items (productId, quantity, variant, unitPrice),
     customerInfo (name, phone, email, preferredContact),
     fulfillmentMethod (delivery/pickup), deliveryAddress,
     paymentMethod (cash/venmo/zelle/stripe),
     notes, createAccount (boolean), promoCode
   }

2. Server-side validation:
   - Verify store exists and is published
   - Verify all products exist and are in stock
   - Recalculate prices server-side (prevent client-side price manipulation)
   - Calculate tax and delivery fee server-side
   - Validate delivery ZIP is in zone (if delivery)

3. Insert into orders table:
   - tenant_id from store
   - store_id
   - order_number (auto-increment per tenant)
   - customer_name, customer_email, customer_phone
   - delivery_address (JSONB)
   - fulfillment_method
   - status: 'pending'
   - subtotal, tax_amount, delivery_fee, total
   - payment_method
   - source: 'storefront'
   - notes

4. Insert order_items for each cart item

5. Decrement product stock_quantity for each item

6. Return { orderId, orderNumber }

title: Checkout handler — create customer profile (guest)
description:
If guest checkout (no account creation):

1. Check customers table for existing customer with same phone OR email
   for this tenant_id
2. If exists: link order to existing customer_id, update their info
3. If not exists: INSERT into customers table:
   - tenant_id
   - name, phone, email
   - preferred_contact_method
   - source: 'storefront'
   - type: 'guest' or 'lead'
   - first_order_at: now()
   - last_order_at: now()
   - total_orders: 1
   - total_spent: order total
   - delivery_address (save for future)
4. Set orders.customer_id = new/existing customer ID

This automatically creates a customer profile in the admin panel's 
customer management section.

title: Checkout handler — create customer account (registered)
description:
If "Create an account" was checked:
1. Create Supabase auth user with email + password
2. Create customer profile (same as guest above but type: 'registered')
3. Link auth user to customer profile
4. Auto-login the user after order
5. If auth creation fails (e.g., email already exists): 
   still complete the order as guest, show message 
   "Order placed! Account creation failed - email may already exist"

title: Checkout handler — Stripe payment processing
description:
If payment_method is 'stripe':
1. Create Stripe PaymentIntent via edge function with amount = total in cents
2. Confirm payment on client with Stripe Elements
3. If payment succeeds: create order with paid_at = now()
4. If payment fails: show error, don't create order
5. Stripe webhook for async payment confirmation (optional but recommended)

If Stripe keys not configured: hide Stripe option in payment selection.

title: Checkout handler — inventory deduction
description:
After order is created:
For each order item: UPDATE products SET stock_quantity = stock_quantity - ordered_quantity
WHERE id = product_id AND tenant_id = tenant_id.
If stock goes below 0: the server-side validation in task-120 should 
have caught this. Add a check: stock_quantity >= ordered_quantity before deducting.
If race condition occurs: rollback order and show "Item went out of stock".

title: Checkout handler — order number generation
description:
Each tenant has their own order number sequence.
Format: #1001, #1002, #1003... (starting at 1001).
Options:
A) PostgreSQL sequence per tenant
B) Query MAX(order_number) for tenant + 1
C) Use a counter in tenant_settings
Must be unique per tenant. Include in order confirmation.

- "Generate Menu Page" button in storefront section
- Options: title, which products to include (all or selected),
  show prices toggle, show descriptions toggle, show images toggle,
  color scheme (match store theme or simple black/white)
- Custom message at top (e.g., "Text us to order!")
- Contact info to show on page
- Slug input for URL (e.g., "weekly-menu" → /menu/weekly-menu.html)

title: Static menu generator — generates HTML
description:
On "Generate" click:
Build a self-contained HTML file with inline CSS (no external deps).
Content: title, products grid with names/prices/images, contact info.
Mobile-responsive. Fast-loading. Clean design.
Save the HTML to Supabase Storage or a dedicated bucket.
Return the URL.

Format: https://{domain}/menu/{slug}.html or served via edge function.

title: Static menu generator — URL management
description:
Admin can see list of all generated menu pages.
Each shows: title, URL (clickable + copy button), created date, 
products count.
Actions: view, regenerate (update with current products), delete.
Table in a MenuPages component.

title: Static menu generator — auto-regenerate
description:
Option to auto-regenerate the static page whenever products or 
prices change. Toggle per menu page.
Or a "Sync Now" button to manually regenerate with latest data.

title: Store sharing — share dialog
description:
"Share Store" button in admin storefront section.
Opens dialog with:
- Store URL with copy button
- QR code generated for the URL (use a QR code library or API)
- Social share buttons (copy link, share to WhatsApp, SMS, email)
- Download QR code as PNG button

title: Store sharing — QR code generation
description:
Generate QR code for store URL and static menu pages.
Use qrcode library (npm install qrcode) or a React QR component.
QR code displayed in share dialog and downloadable.
Tenant can print QR code on receipts, flyers, business cards.

title: Checkout — prevent double order submission
description:
Disable "Place Order" button immediately on click.
Show loading spinner. Don't re-enable until response.
If user clicks again (fast click): second click is no-op.
If browser refreshes during submission: order should not duplicate.
Use idempotency key if possible.

title: Checkout — handle network errors
description:
If the checkout API call fails (network error, 500, timeout):
Show clear error: "Something went wrong. Please try again."
Re-enable the Place Order button.
Don't navigate to confirmation page.
Don't clear the cart (so user can retry).

title: Checkout — handle out-of-stock during checkout
description:
If between adding to cart and placing order, a product goes out of stock:
Server validates stock → returns error for specific items.
Show: "Sorry, {product name} is no longer available."
Remove that item from cart or show it as unavailable.
Let user continue with remaining items.

title: Store not found — styled 404 page
description:
Visiting /shop/nonexistent-slug shows a styled 404 page:
- Store illustration or icon
- "Store Not Found"
- "The store you're looking for doesn't exist or has been taken offline."
- "Check the URL and try again."
Not a raw white page or React error boundary.

title: Product not found — 404 page
description:
Visiting /shop/:slug/products/nonexistent-id shows:
"Product Not Found" with a "Browse Products" button.
Don't crash or show blank page.

title: Empty store — no products state
description:
If store is published but has zero visible products:
ProductCatalogPage shows: "Products coming soon! Check back later."
ProductGridSection on homepage shows nothing or a "Coming Soon" message.
Checkout should not be reachable (no add to cart possible).

title: Cart — validate cart on checkout page load
description:
When CheckoutPage loads:
1. Verify all cart items still exist in the database
2. Verify all cart items are still in stock
3. Verify prices haven't changed
If prices changed: update cart to new prices, show notice.
If item removed: remove from cart, show notice.
If all items gone: redirect to empty cart page.

title: Cart — max quantity enforcement
description:
Can't add more than stock_quantity of a product.
If user tries: show toast "Only {X} available".
Quantity selector capped at stock level.

title: Delivery zone — ZIP code validation
description:
On checkout with delivery:
Customer enters ZIP code → validate against store's delivery_zones.
If ZIP is in a zone: show that zone's delivery fee and estimated time.
If ZIP is not in any zone: "Sorry, we don't deliver to this area."
Disable "Continue" until a valid delivery address is entered.

title: Phone number — validation and formatting
description:
Phone field on checkout:
Accept common formats: (555) 123-4567, 555-123-4567, 5551234567, +15551234567.
Normalize to a standard format before saving.
Validate it's a real-looking US phone (10 digits).
Show formatted display after entry.

title: Email — validation
description:
If email is entered on checkout:
Validate with Zod email schema.
Show inline error for invalid format.
Email is optional for guest checkout (phone is primary).

title: Price display — consistent formatting
description:
All prices throughout the app display as $XX.XX format.
Use a formatPrice utility: (cents or dollars) → "$12.99"
Check: cart, checkout, order confirmation, admin orders, analytics.
No floating point weirdness ($12.989999999).

title: Long product names — truncation
description:
Product names that are very long (50+ chars) should truncate with 
ellipsis on cards, table rows, cart items.
Full name visible on product detail page.
Use CSS: text-overflow: ellipsis; overflow: hidden; white-space: nowrap;
Or line-clamp for multi-line truncation.

title: Image loading — lazy load and placeholders
description:
All product images use loading="lazy" attribute.
Show a skeleton placeholder while image loads.
If image fails to load (broken URL): show a styled placeholder 
(store icon or product icon), not broken image icon.
Use onError handler on img tags.

title: Special characters in names
description:
Test with special characters in:
- Product names: "Gee's Smoke Shop™ — OG Kush (28g)"
- Customer names: "José García-López"
- Store names: "Snak Station #1 (LES)"
No XSS vulnerabilities (sanitize all user input).
No display issues or encoding problems.

title: Search sanitization
description:
Product search input on catalog page:
Sanitize input to prevent SQL injection or XSS.
If using Supabase .ilike() or .textSearch(): input is parameterized (safe).
If using raw SQL: use parameterized queries.
Also sanitize before displaying search term in "No results for '{term}'"

title: Session expiry — admin doesn't lose work
description:
If admin's Supabase auth session expires while editing the builder:
Show a "Session expired" modal with re-login form.
Don't lose the current builder state.
After re-login: resume where they left off.

title: Concurrent admin editing — last write wins
description:
If two admins edit the same store simultaneously:
Add updated_at check before saving.
If store.updated_at > last fetched: show warning 
"This store was modified by another user. Reload or overwrite?"

title: Large layout_config — performance
description:
If tenant creates 20+ sections:
Builder should still scroll smoothly.
Preview shouldn't lag.
JSON serialization of large layout_config shouldn't be slow.
Test with 20 sections of various types.

title: Image upload — size limits and validation
description:
Hero image, product images, gallery images, logo:
Max file size: 5MB (show error if exceeded).
Accepted formats: jpg, jpeg, png, webp, gif.
Validate MIME type, not just extension.
Compress/resize large images before upload if possible.
Show upload progress indicator.

title: Cart persistence — localStorage
description:
Verify cart persists when:
- User refreshes the page
- User navigates between store pages
- User closes and reopens browser tab
Cart stored in localStorage with STORAGE_KEYS constant.
Wrapped in try-catch (some browsers block localStorage).
Cart scoped to store slug (different stores = different carts).

title: Cart — clear after successful order
description:
After order is successfully placed:
Call clearCart() to empty the cart.
Verify: place order → cart badge goes to 0 → cart page shows empty.
Cart should NOT be cleared if order fails.

title: Checkout — back button handling
description:
On checkout page, user clicks browser back button:
Should go back to previous step (Step 2 → Step 1).
If on Step 1: back goes to cart page.
Don't lose form data when going back within steps.

title: All forms use React Hook Form + Zod
description:
Verify that ALL forms in storefront feature use React Hook Form + Zod:
- Store creation form
- Section edit dialogs
- Settings forms (all tabs)
- Checkout customer info form
- Checkout address form
- Product create/edit form
If any form uses uncontrolled inputs or manual validation, 
refactor to React Hook Form + Zod.

title: Form errors — inline display
description:
All form validation errors show inline below the field.
Red text, small font, with error icon.
Field border turns red on error.
Errors clear when user fixes the input.
Don't show all errors at once — show on blur or submit.

title: Required fields — asterisk indicator
description:
All required form fields show a red asterisk (*) next to the label.
Consistent across all forms.

title: Every page has loading state
description:
Audit every storefront page for loading states:
- StorefrontBuilder: skeleton for section list + preview
- StorefrontSettings: skeleton for form fields
- StorefrontLiveOrders: skeleton for table rows
- StorefrontAnalytics: skeleton for chart areas + KPI cards
- StorefrontPage: skeleton for sections
- ProductCatalogPage: skeleton card grid
- ProductDetailPage: skeleton for image + info
- CartPage: skeleton for item rows
- CheckoutPage: skeleton for form
Use shadcn Skeleton component. No spinner-only states for content areas.

title: Every page has empty state
description:
Audit every page for empty states (when there's no data):
- Builder: "Create Your Store" card
- Live Orders: "No orders yet" with share store link
- Analytics: "No data yet" with helpful message
- Product Catalog: "No products found" with clear filters
- Cart: "Your cart is empty" with continue shopping link
Each empty state has an illustration/icon, helpful message, 
and a primary action button.

title: Every page has error state
description:
Audit every page for error states (when query fails):
Each should show: error icon, message, "Try Again" button that refetches.
NOT a blank page or unhandled error.
Use React Error Boundary as a catch-all fallback.

title: Storefront homepage — mobile layout
description:
Test /shop/:slug at 375px width (iPhone SE).
Hero section: text scales, CTA button full-width.
Product grid: 2 columns or 1 column depending on card size.
Features: stack vertically.
All sections must not overflow horizontally (no horizontal scroll).

title: Product catalog — mobile layout
description:
At 375px width:
- Filters hidden, "Filters" button shows drawer
- Product grid: 2 columns
- Sort dropdown accessible
- Search input full-width
- Product cards: image, name, price, add to cart — all visible

title: Product detail — mobile layout
description:
At 375px:
- Image gallery: horizontal swipe carousel
- Info section stacks below images
- Add to Cart button: fixed bottom bar or large button
- Related products: horizontal scroll
- All text readable, no overflow

title: Cart — mobile layout
description:
At 375px:
- Cart items stack vertically
- Quantity controls accessible (44px touch targets)
- Order summary below items
- Checkout button: full-width, bottom of page
- Remove item: swipe to delete or clear X button

title: Checkout — mobile layout
description:
At 375px:
- Step indicator: compact, horizontal pills
- Form fields: full-width, stacked
- Payment options: full-width cards/buttons
- Order summary: collapsible section at top
- Place Order: full-width button, fixed at bottom

title: Order confirmation — mobile layout
description:
At 375px:
- Success animation visible
- Order details readable
- Telegram/custom link button: large, prominent, full-width
- Status timeline: vertical, left-aligned

title: Admin builder — mobile handling
description:
Admin builder is primarily a desktop tool, but if accessed on mobile:
Show message: "Storefront Builder works best on desktop. 
Open on a computer for the full editing experience."
Alternatively, show only Easy Mode on mobile.

title: Admin live orders — mobile layout
description:
On mobile: orders table becomes card list.
Each card: order #, customer name, total, status badge, time.
Tap card: opens detail panel (full-screen on mobile).

title: Touch targets — minimum 44px
description:
Audit all interactive elements on mobile:
- Buttons: min height 44px
- Links in nav: min height 44px
- Quantity +/- buttons: min 44px × 44px
- Filter checkboxes: min 44px touch area
- Cart item remove button: min 44px
Fix any elements smaller than 44px.

title: No horizontal scroll anywhere
description:
On mobile (375px), no page should have horizontal scroll.
Common causes: images without max-width, tables without overflow,
absolute positioned elements extending beyond viewport.
Test every storefront page. Add overflow-x: hidden on body or 
fix the actual overflowing elements.

title: Mobile — font sizes readable
description:
Minimum font size on mobile: 14px for body text, 12px for labels.
Headings scale appropriately (not too large on small screens).
Product prices always readable (not truncated or tiny).

title: Mobile — image sizing
description:
All images responsive (max-width: 100%, height: auto).
Product images in catalog: equal aspect ratio (use object-fit: cover).
Hero background image: covers viewport width.
Gallery images: don't stretch or distort.

title: Mobile — keyboard handling
description:
When mobile keyboard opens (focusing input field):
Form should scroll up so the focused field is visible.
Fixed bottom bars shouldn't cover the input.
"Place Order" button accessible after filling form.

title: Mobile — bottom nav z-index
description:
Bottom navigation bar (if exists) must:
- Be above page content (z-index)
- Not cover the last item in scrollable lists (add padding-bottom)
- Not overlap with fixed checkout button
- Hide when keyboard is open (optional)

title: Tablet layout — 768px breakpoint
description:
Test all storefront pages at 768px (iPad):
- Product grid: 2-3 columns
- Sidebar filters: visible but narrower
- Checkout: still side-by-side layout
- Builder: compact but usable
Ensure no layout breaks between mobile and desktop.

title: Offline indicator
description:
If customer loses internet connection while browsing:
Show a non-intrusive banner: "You're offline. Some features may not work."
Cart should still work (local state).
Checkout should show error if attempted offline.

title: Slow connection handling
description:
On slow 3G connections:
- Images lazy load (don't block page render)
- Skeleton states visible during loading
- Checkout has timeout handling (30 second timeout)
- User sees progress, not blank pages

title: RLS — marketplace_stores
description:
Verify RLS policies on marketplace_stores:
- SELECT: anyone can read published stores (for public storefront)
- SELECT: authenticated users can read their tenant's stores (any status)
- INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE: only tenant admins
Test: one tenant cannot see or modify another tenant's store.

title: RLS — orders
description:
Verify RLS on orders:
- INSERT: edge function (service role) can create orders for any tenant
- SELECT: tenant admins can only see their orders
- UPDATE: tenant admins can only update their orders
- Customer can see their own order (by order ID, for tracking)
Test: tenant A cannot see tenant B's orders.

title: RLS — customers
description:
Verify RLS on customers:
- SELECT/UPDATE: only tenant admins for their tenant's customers
- INSERT: edge function can create for any tenant
Test: tenant isolation.

title: RLS — products
description:
Verify RLS on products:
- SELECT: public can read active/published products (for storefront)
- INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE: only tenant admins
Test: public can browse products, can't modify them.

title: Server-side price validation
description:
The storefront-checkout edge function MUST validate prices server-side.
Don't trust client-sent prices.
Fetch product prices from database, calculate totals server-side.
If client total doesn't match server total: use server total.
This prevents customers from manipulating prices via devtools.

title: Rate limiting — checkout
description:
Prevent spam orders:
Rate limit the checkout endpoint.
Max 5 orders per IP per hour.
Max 3 orders per phone number per hour.
Return 429 if rate limited.

title: Input sanitization — all user inputs
description:
All text inputs from customers (name, address, notes, search) must be:
- Trimmed of leading/trailing whitespace
- Sanitized for XSS (no script injection)
- Validated against expected format (phone, email, ZIP)
- Stored as plain text (no HTML in database)
Use DOMPurify for any HTML rendering.
Use Zod schemas for all input validation.

title: CORS — edge functions
description:
All edge functions must return proper CORS headers:
Access-Control-Allow-Origin (configured for your domain)
Access-Control-Allow-Methods: POST, OPTIONS
Access-Control-Allow-Headers: Content-Type, Authorization
Handle OPTIONS preflight requests.

title: Stripe keys — not exposed client-side
description:
Stripe SECRET key must ONLY be in edge functions (server-side).
Stripe PUBLISHABLE key is fine client-side.
Check: no sk_test_ or sk_live_ strings in any src/ files.
Run: grep -rn "sk_test\|sk_live" src/

title: Telegram bot token — not exposed client-side
description:
Bot token must ONLY be in edge functions.
Frontend sends orderId + tenantId to edge function.
Edge function reads bot token from tenant_settings using service role.
Check: no bot token strings in src/ files.

title: Customer data — no cross-tenant leakage
description:
Verify: visiting /shop/store-a shows ONLY store-a's products.
/shop/store-b shows ONLY store-b's products.
Orders from store-a only visible to store-a's admin.
Customer profiles from store-a only in store-a's admin.
Run manual test with 2 different stores.

title: XSS — Custom HTML section
description: CustomHTMLSection sanitizes content with DOMPurify. Test with script injection: Should be stripped out, not executed. Test with image onerror: Should be stripped.

title: Order access — customer can only see their order
description:
OrderConfirmationPage at /shop/:slug/order/:orderId
Customer should only see their own order (by the orderId they received).
They should NOT be able to enumerate other order IDs.
Use UUID for orderId (not sequential numbers) for the URL.
Order number (sequential) is for display only.

title: Product images — optimize loading
description:
All product images on catalog page: loading="lazy".
First 4 images (above fold): eager loading.
Use appropriate image sizes (don't load 4000px images for thumbnails).
If Supabase Storage supports transforms: use width/height params.

title: TanStack Query — stale times
description:
Set appropriate staleTime for storefront queries:
- Store data: 5 minutes (stores don't change often)
- Products: 2 minutes (stock can change)
- Orders (admin): 30 seconds (need to see new orders quickly)
- Analytics: 5 minutes
Don't refetch on every component mount.

title: TanStack Query — prefetching
description:
Prefetch product detail data when hovering over a product card.
Use queryClient.prefetchQuery on hover.
Result: instant page load when clicking the product.

title: Bundle size — code splitting
description:
Storefront pages should be code-split from admin pages.
Use React.lazy + Suspense for route-level code splitting:
const StorefrontPage = lazy(() => import('./pages/shop/StorefrontPage'));
Admin users don't need to download storefront code and vice versa.
Verify: build output shows separate chunks for shop/ and admin/.

title: Product catalog — query optimization
description:
Product catalog queries should:
- Select only needed columns (not SELECT *)
- Use pagination (limit/offset or cursor)
- Use database indexes on: tenant_id, category, price, created_at
- Filter server-side, not client-side
If loading 1000+ products: must paginate, not load all at once.

title: Realtime subscriptions — cleanup
description:
Supabase Realtime subscriptions in Live Orders must be properly cleaned up.
useEffect cleanup: unsubscribe on unmount.
Don't create multiple subscriptions on re-renders.
Verify: navigate away from live orders → subscription removed.
Navigate back → new subscription created (no duplicates).

title: Admin analytics — memoize expensive calculations
description:
Analytics dashboard aggregations (sums, averages, groupings):
Use useMemo to avoid recalculating on every render.
Charts should only re-render when data changes.

title: Keyboard navigation — all interactive elements
description:
All buttons, links, inputs, toggles, cards:
Must be reachable via Tab key.
Must show visible focus ring (outline) when focused.
Must be activatable with Enter or Space.
Tab order should follow visual order.

title: ARIA labels — icon buttons
description:
All icon-only buttons must have aria-label:
- Cart icon: aria-label="Shopping cart, {N} items"
- Delete button: aria-label="Delete {item name}"
- Edit button: aria-label="Edit {section name}"
- Close button: aria-label="Close"
- Search: aria-label="Search products"
Audit all icon buttons across storefront pages.

title: Color contrast — WCAG AA
description:
Verify text color contrast against backgrounds meets WCAG AA (4.5:1).
Especially check:
- Light themes: gray text on white backgrounds
- Dark themes: gray text on dark backgrounds
- Status badges: text readable on colored backgrounds
- Buttons: text readable on primary color backgrounds

title: Alt text — all images
description:
All product images: alt="{product name}"
Hero background images: alt="" (decorative) with aria-hidden="true"
Logo: alt="{store name} logo"
Gallery images: alt="{store name} gallery image {N}" or custom alt
No broken or missing alt attributes.

title: Screen reader — checkout flow
description:
Checkout step changes must announce to screen readers.
Use aria-live="polite" on step content area.
Form errors must be announced.
Success/error toasts must have role="alert".
Order confirmation must be announced.

title: Semantic HTML — headings hierarchy
description:
Each page has exactly one h1.
Headings follow hierarchy: h1 > h2 > h3 (no skipping).
Sections use proper semantic elements (<section>, <nav>, <main>, <footer>).
Product catalog: page title is h1, product names are h2 or h3.

title: Focus management — modals and dialogs
description:
When a dialog/modal opens: focus moves to the dialog.
When it closes: focus returns to the trigger element.
Tab cannot escape the dialog while open (focus trap).
shadcn Dialog component handles this, but verify custom dialogs too.

title: Toast notifications — consistent usage
description:
Use Sonner for all toasts. Consistent patterns:
- Success (green): save, publish, add to cart, place order
- Error (red): validation errors, network errors, stock errors
- Info (blue): informational messages
- Warning (yellow): unsaved changes, low stock
Toasts appear bottom-right (desktop) or top-center (mobile).
Max 3 visible at once.

title: Button loading states
description:
All action buttons show loading state during async operations:
- "Save Draft" → spinner + "Saving..."
- "Publish" → spinner + "Publishing..."
- "Place Order" → spinner + "Processing..."
- "Add to Cart" → brief spinner → "Added ✓"
Use shadcn Button with disabled state + Loader2 spinner icon.

title: Hover and interaction feedback
description:
All interactive elements have hover/active states:
- Buttons: slight color darken on hover, scale down on click
- Product cards: subtle shadow elevation on hover
- Links: underline on hover or color change
- Table rows: background highlight on hover
- Drag handles: cursor changes to grab/grabbing

title: Theme consistency — colors match throughout
description:
For each theme (Dark, Minimalist, Strain, Luxury):
Verify ALL storefront pages use theme CSS variables for:
- Background color
- Text color
- Primary button color
- Card background
- Border colors
- Link colors
No hardcoded colors that break theme consistency.

title: Animations — subtle and purposeful
description:
Add subtle animations where they enhance UX:
- Page transitions: fade-in on route change
- Cart badge: bounce when item count changes
- Order confirmation: confetti or checkmark animation
- Skeleton loading: pulse animation
- Slide-over panels: slide-in from right
- Toasts: slide-in from bottom
Use CSS transitions or Framer Motion. Don't overdo it.

title: Hero section — responsive background
description:
Hero section background image:
- object-fit: cover
- Centered
- Gradient overlay applied correctly
- On mobile: image still looks good (consider mobile crop)
- Fallback: themed gradient if no image set

title: Product cards — uniform height
description:
In product grid, all cards should be same height in each row.
Image area: fixed aspect ratio (e.g., 1:1 or 4:3).
Product name: max 2 lines with line-clamp.
Price: aligned at bottom of card.
Add to Cart button: always at bottom.

title: Dark theme — all elements readable
description:
In Dark theme: verify all text is readable against dark backgrounds.
Input fields: visible border or lighter background.
Modals: proper contrast.
Dropdowns: visible options.
Common issue: white text on light input background in dark theme.

title: Luxury theme — gold accents applied
description:
Luxury theme should feel premium:
- Dark background (#1a1a2e)
- Gold primary (#d4af37)
- Gold borders and accents
- Serif font for headings
- Subtle gradients
Verify: buttons gold, links gold, badges have gold tint.

title: Print stylesheet — order receipt
description:
In admin order detail, "Print" button should print a clean receipt.
Print CSS: hide nav, sidebar, buttons.
Show: store name, order #, items, totals, customer info.
A4 paper-friendly layout.
Test: Ctrl+P on order detail → clean output.

title: Confirmation — prominent Telegram/contact button
description:
The tenant's Telegram/WhatsApp/custom link button on the confirmation page
must be visually prominent:
- Large button (not a text link)
- Brand-colored or store-themed
- Icon + label (e.g., Telegram paper plane icon + "Message us on Telegram")
- Opens in new tab
This is the primary CTA on the confirmation page after the success message.

title: Confirmation — store branding
description:
Confirmation page shows store name and logo.
Uses store's theme colors.
Feels like part of the store experience, not a generic page.

title: Admin dashboard — storefront widget
description:
On the main admin dashboard, add a "Storefront" widget/card showing:
- Store status (Published/Draft)
- Today's orders count
- Today's revenue
- Link to "Manage Store"
- Link to "View Live Orders"
Quick overview without navigating to storefront sub-pages.

title: Getting started guide — for new tenants
description:
For new tenants with no store and no products:
Show a "Getting Started" checklist in the storefront section:
1. ✅ Create your store
2. ⬜ Add products (with link to products page)
3. ⬜ Customize your storefront
4. ⬜ Configure delivery/pickup
5. ⬜ Set up payment methods
6. ⬜ Publish your store
7. ⬜ Share your store link
Items check off as completed. Dismissible once all done.

title: Quick actions — from admin header
description:
Admin header quick action buttons:
- "View Store" → opens public store in new tab
- "Share" → opens share dialog
- Notification bell → shows new order alerts
Accessible from any admin page.

title: Settings — simple language
description:
All settings labels should be plain English:
Instead of "Enable CORS" → "Allow your store to be embedded on other websites"
Instead of "Tax Rate" → "Sales Tax (%)" with placeholder "e.g., 8.875 for NYC"
Help text below complex fields explaining what they do.

title: Builder — section type descriptions
description:
In the "Add Section" dropdown, each option has a brief description:
- Hero Banner: "A full-width image banner with headline and call-to-action"
- Product Grid: "Showcase your products in a grid layout"
- Features: "Highlight what makes your store special"
etc.
Helps non-technical users understand what each section type does.

title: Builder — real product data in preview
description:
The Product Grid section in the builder preview should show 
ACTUAL products from the tenant's inventory, not placeholder data.
If no products exist: show "Add products to see them here" in preview.

title: Live Orders — one-click contact
description:
In the order detail panel, customer contact shortcuts:
- Phone icon → opens tel: link (calls on mobile, shows number on desktop)
- SMS icon → opens sms: link with pre-filled message
- Email icon → opens mailto: with subject "Order #{number}"
- Telegram icon → opens Telegram link (if configured)
One click, no copy-pasting.

title: Live Orders — sound on new order
description:
When a new order comes in via Realtime:
Play a short notification sound (bell or ding).
Use Audio API. Sound file: host a small MP3 in public/ folder.
Toggle in settings: "Play sound for new orders"
Don't play if tab is in background and browser blocks audio.

title: Live Orders — order timestamp formatting
description:
Order times display as relative for recent orders:
- < 1 min: "Just now"
- < 60 min: "X min ago"
- < 24 hours: "X hours ago"
- >= 24 hours: "Jan 15 at 3:30 PM"
Update the relative time periodically (every 30 seconds).

title: Products — quick add flow
description:
Simplify adding a product:

description:

title: Products — sort and filter in admin
description:
Admin products table should be sortable by:
Name, Price, Stock, Category, Created Date.
Filterable by: category, in stock / out of stock, visible on storefront.
Searchable by name.

title: Orders — export to CSV
description:
"Export Orders" button in Live Orders page.
Downloads CSV with: order #, date, customer name, phone, email,
items (concatenated), subtotal, tax, delivery, total, status, payment method.

title: Order detail — edit order
description:
Admin can edit an order (before it's completed):
- Change quantities
- Remove items
- Add notes
- Adjust delivery fee
- Recalculate total
Save changes. Helpful for phone orders or corrections.

title: Order detail — cancel with reason
description:
"Cancel Order" prompts for a reason:
Dropdown: "Customer requested", "Out of stock", "Unable to deliver", "Other"
Reason saved to order. Status set to 'cancelled'.
If customer email: send cancellation email.
Restore stock quantities for cancelled items.

title: Dashboard — revenue period comparison
description:
KPI cards show comparison to previous period:
"Revenue: $1,234 (+15% vs last week)"
Green arrow up for increase, red arrow down for decrease.
Previous period = same length, immediately prior.

title: Settings — payment method save and load
description:

description:

title: Settings — Telegram config save and load
description:

2. Save

title: Settings — all saves show success toast
description:
Every Save button in settings, when clicked:
- Shows loading state
- On success: green toast "Settings saved"
- On error: red toast with error message

title: Sidebar — storefront group expanded by default
description:
When navigating to any storefront admin page:
The Storefront nav group in sidebar should be expanded.
Active page highlighted.

title: Sidebar — order count badge
description:
"Live Orders" nav item shows a badge with pending order count.
Badge updates in real-time.
If 0 pending: no badge.
Red pulsing badge if > 0.

description:

description:

description:

Step 8: Selects Venmo → sees "Send payment to @snak-station" with copy button

Step 9: Places order

Payment processes → order created with paid_at timestamp.

Order created with fulfillment_method = 'pickup'.
Admin sees "Pickup" badge on order.

title: E2E: Account creation during checkout

Supabase auth user created.

Customer with previous order enters same phone number at checkout.

Auto-fills name and address if available.

Admin sees updated total_orders and total_spent on customer profile.

description:
1. Order arrives as "pending"

description:

4. Customer from Store A: visible only in Tenant A's customers
Complete isolation.

description:

description:
Admin publishes store with 0 products.

title: E2E: Theme change — reflected on storefront
description:

description:

description:

title: E2E: Customer adds to cart → leaves → comes back
description:

3. Reopens /shop/:slug

description:

title: E2E: Static menu page — generate and view
description:

5. Page loads fast (no JS framework needed, just HTML)

title: E2E: Builder → Settings → Orders integration
description:
Verify data flows between builder, settings, and orders:
1. Store name set in Settings → shows on storefront header

3. Delivery zones set in Settings → enforced at checkout
4. Payment methods set in Settings → shown at checkout

title: Customer profile completeness after order
description:
After a guest places an order, verify customer profile in admin has:
- Name ✓
- Phone ✓
- Email (if provided) ✓
- Preferred contact method ✓
- Delivery address (if delivery) ✓
- Order history (at least 1 order) ✓
- Items they ordered (visible in order details) ✓
- Total spent ✓
- Source: "storefront" ✓
All fields populated, no nulls for required data.

title: Order line items match cart
description:
Verify: what customer adds to cart = exactly what's in order_items.
Product names, quantities, prices all match.
No extra items, no missing items.
Variant selection preserved in order_items.

title: Order totals are mathematically correct
description:
Verify totals at every stage:
Cart subtotal = sum of (price × quantity) for all items ✓
Tax = subtotal × tax_rate ✓
Delivery fee from matching zone ✓
Total = subtotal + tax + delivery_fee - discount ✓
These match between: cart page, checkout page, order confirmation,
admin order detail, and database record.

title: Multi-item order — all items tracked
description:
Place order with 5 different products.
Verify all 5 appear in:
- Order confirmation page
- Admin order detail
- order_items table (5 rows)
- Customer profile order history

title: Order source correctly tagged
description:
Orders from storefront have source = 'storefront' in database.
This distinguishes from POS orders, wholesale orders, etc.
Admin can filter orders by source if needed.
Analytics should be able to separate storefront revenue from other sources.

title: storefront-checkout edge function — exists and deploys
description:
Verify supabase/functions/storefront-checkout/index.ts exists.
Function handles POST with CORS.
Receives: storeSlug, items, customerInfo, fulfillmentMethod, paymentMethod, etc.
Returns: { orderId, orderNumber } on success.
Returns: { error: string } with appropriate HTTP status on failure.
If function doesn't exist: CREATE IT.

title: storefront-checkout — server-side price validation
description:
Inside the checkout function:
For each item in the order, fetch the product from database.
Use the DATABASE price, not the client-sent price.
Calculate subtotal, tax, delivery fee, total server-side.
If client total differs: use server total (log the discrepancy).

title: storefront-checkout — stock validation
description:
Check stock_quantity >= ordered quantity for each item.
If any item is out of stock: return 400 with specific error 
identifying which products are unavailable.
Don't create a partial order — it's all or nothing.

title: storefront-checkout — customer upsert
description:
In the checkout function:
After creating the order, upsert the customer:
- Find existing customer by phone + tenant_id
- If exists: update last_order_at, increment total_orders, add to total_spent
- If not: create new customer with all info
- Set orders.customer_id = customer.id

title: storefront-checkout — order number generation
description:
Generate sequential order number per tenant.
Query: SELECT COALESCE(MAX(order_number), 1000) + 1 FROM orders WHERE tenant_id = X
This gives the next number.
Handle race condition: use a PostgreSQL advisory lock or 
UNIQUE constraint + retry on conflict.

title: storefront-checkout — inventory deduction
storefront-checkout — trigger Telegram notification
description:
After order is saved:
Fetch tenant's Telegram settings.
If auto-forward enabled and bot_token + chat_id configured:
Call forward-order-telegram function or inline the Telegram API call.
Don't block the order response on Telegram success/failure.
Use a non-blocking approach (fire and forget or edge function invoke).

title: storefront-checkout — error handling
description:
The checkout function must handle all error cases:
- Invalid/missing required fields → 400 with field-specific errors
- Store not found → 404
- Store not published → 403
- Products not found → 400
- Out of stock → 400 with product details
- Database error → 500 with generic error (don't leak DB details)
- Stripe error → 402 with Stripe error message
Every error returns JSON { error: string, details?: object }

title: forward-order-telegram — edge function
description:
Create or verify: supabase/functions/forward-order-telegram/index.ts
Input: { orderId, tenantId } or full order data
Fetches: order, order_items, customer, tenant Telegram config
Sends formatted message to Telegram via Bot API
Returns: success/failure
CORS headers. Error handling.

title: get_marketplace_store_by_slug — RPC function
description:
Verify this RPC function exists and works:
Input: store slug
Returns: full store data including layout_config, theme, settings
Only returns published stores (unless called by admin with preview flag)
If missing: create as a SQL function or replace with direct query.

title: get_marketplace_products — RPC function
description:
Verify this RPC function exists:
Input: tenant_id, optional filters (category, search, sort, limit, offset)
Returns: products with images, categories
Only active/visible products
If missing: replace with direct query in the frontend.

title: Checkout — client-side fallback if edge function fails
description:
If storefront-checkout edge function is not deployed or returns 500:
Implement a client-side fallback that directly inserts into Supabase:

1. Insert order via supabase.from('orders').insert(...)
2. Insert order_items via supabase.from('order_items').insert(...)
3. Insert/update customer via supabase.from('customers').upsert(...)
4. Deduct stock via supabase.rpc('deduct_stock', ...) or direct update

This ensures checkout works even if edge functions are down.
The frontend should TRY the edge function first, then fallback.
Both paths should produce identical results.

title: Telegram — client-side fallback
description:
If Telegram edge function fails:
Frontend can call Telegram Bot API directly (less secure but functional).
Only as last resort — bot token would be fetched server-side and 
passed to a thin client helper. Or just log the failure and skip.

title: Create deduct_stock RPC function
Create customer upsert RPC function
description:
Create function to upsert customer on checkout:

Takes: tenant_id, name, phone, email, preferred_contact, address, order_total
Logic:
- Find by phone + tenant_id
- If exists: update name, email, last_order_at, increment total_orders, add to total_spent
- If not: insert with all fields, total_orders = 1, total_spent = order_total
- Returns: customer_id

SECURITY DEFINER with search_path = public.

Verify customers table has all needed columns

In .env.example or README.

grep -rn "sk_test\|sk_live\|service_role\|bot_token" dist/
